page.title: 06Oil slick threatens birdlife
page.content: Two large oil slicks are feared to be heading towards the bird sanctuary island of Grassholm after a 1300 ton oil tanker,the 'Brigeness',collided with rocks known as the Barrels three miles west of the island on Sunday night,discharging 310 tonnes of heavy fuel oil into the sea. This was the report in the County Echo of 18th June 1985. The R.S.P.B. went out to Grassholm to save the Gannets and the Puffins.We don't know how many have died but it wasn't the Gannets that were affected the most-it was the Puffins. It was when the birds dived into the sea that they were affected,because when they surfaced they were too heavy to fly.They then pecked the oil off their plumage and then they got poisoned.
